page.title: 04PITSFORD RESERVOIR
page.content: DESPITE THE PROLIFIC QUANTITIES OF RAIN WHICH SEEM TO FALL ON ENGLAND THERE IS A PERPETUAL WATER SHORTAGE. THIS IS CAUSED BY THE WASTEFUL WAY IN WHICH IT IS USED BY THE AVERAGE CONSUMER AND HIS FAMILY. RATES OF WATER CONSUMPTION ARE PRESENTLY IN THE REGION OF 180 LITRES PER PERSON PER DAY AND RISING, SO THAT THERE IS A CONSTANT NEED FOR MORE RESERVOIR CAPACITY. PITSFORD RESERVOIR, BUILT AS A RESPONSE TO THIS NEED FOR INCREASING AMOUNTS OF WATER PER PERSON, WAS OPENED IN 1956 BY THE QUEEN MOTHER. IN ADDITION TO ITS FUNCTION AS A WATER TREATMENT WORKS IT ALSO PROVIDES SUPER LEISURE FACILITIES IN THE FORM OF SAILING,BIRD WATCHING,NATURE TRAILS, FISHING AND A CONSERVATION AREA FOR SEVERAL SPECIES OF PLANTS AND ANIMALS. IT PROVIDES EMPLOYMENT AND HOUSES ALSO
